author: Special Correspondent
text:
Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) machines, meant to be used in Madurai East Assembly Constituency during the Assembly election, arrived here on Sunday.

Returning Officer K. Veera Raghava Rao inspected the boxes containing the machines which were brought from Bihar. The boxes were kept at the Corporation building. Mr. Rao said that 3,424 ballot units and as many control units were available in Madurai for the May 16 polls to be held in 10 Assembly segments in the district. Another 5,000 units would be brought very soon.

Among the 10 Assembly constituencies, the VVPAT machines, which would display the printed symbol of the party/ candidate to whom the vote is cast by the voter, would be used only in 505 polling stations in Madurai East Assembly constituency as per the decision of the Election Commission.

Several rounds of checking of the functioning of electronic voting machines would be done before the mock poll done before the actual polling on May 16.
title: VVPAT machines reach Madurai
